Description:
AS GOOD AS IT GETS....
Look beyond the facade, a new benchmark in stylish sophisticated living has been set with extraordinary attention to detail and the very best selection of fittings, fixtures, and joinery throughout...
Various living zones include a combined formal lounge and dining room with built in timber and glass display cabinet, spacious living room with built in Jarrah wall unit and hidden projector screen operated by the flick of a switch converting this space into a home theatre. The grand double entry hall leads to an open plan family and meals area with built in wall units and gas log fire adjoining the chefs kitchen complete with granite benches and splashbacks, double s/s oven and huge walk-in pantry.
A sunroom at the rear of the dwelling comprising 6 sliding glass doors makes this versatile space your outdoor entertaining area in summer and another cosy living area during the winter months complemented with a built in 6 burner B.B.Q, rangehood and gas heating.
Three bedrooms plus office or 4 bedrooms include an ensuite and two walk in robes to the main, the second and third bedroom both have direct access to the main bathroom. Additional features include: the fourth bedroom setup as an office/library with 2 built in work stations and floor to ceiling Jarrah bookshelves, ducted gas heating, ducted refrigerated cooling, external double glazed windows, powder room, drying room, ducted vacuum, security camera system, automatic lock-up front gates, paved patio and double lock up garage with roof storage.
REMARKS: A stunning showpiece in every way for the discerning buyer who is waiting for that 'something special' without compromise or substitution.
Insights: 19 The Strand, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Prime Kennington
A stylish cream brick veneer in popular Mahon Avenue. Consisting of three bedrooms with an abundance of natural light. The home features an expansive living area looking onto the oversized front patio. Close to schools, public transport and 5 minute drive to the CBD or Latrobe University.
Warm honey coloured polished hardwood floors meander through the residence.
Excellent floorplan with oversized lounge with RVC , French doors and high ceilings.
Highly sort after position ,excellent allotment size of 593m2 approx.
Tastefully renovated bathroom in recent years.
A terrific opportunity to invest in or to owner occupy.

Description:
Art Deco Inspiration
Perfectly located in popular Kennington and on the fringe of Central Bendigo is this Character-filled home complete with polished timber floor boards, feature double-hung timber windows and high ceilings.
Enjoy the conveniences of a 'walk-to-town' lifestyle with Train Station, Lake Weeroona & Coles Supermarket only minutes away. Situated in the Bendigo South East school zone the property is ideal for a small family, first home buyer or investor alike.
With plenty of scope to add your own touch the Art Deco inspired home features 3 generous bedrooms plus 4th bedroom or study depending on your need, lounge plus formal dining room, central kitchen and all climate controlled via the ducted heating and cooling units.
The rear yard is a blank canvas with plenty of space for the buyer to add shedding, gardens and an entertaining area with views toward the CBD.
Capitalise on this unique opportunity in the thriving regional city of Bendigo.
Insights: 29 Murphy Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
"Top Location, Low Price!"
Neat, tidy and private this 2- bedroom brick unit is close to the CBD, convenient and low maintenance. Both spacious bedrooms offer built in robes, open plan dining and living area. The kitchen features gas appliances, servery and external access out to the courtyard. The bathroom comprises of shower, single vanity, bath and a separate walk through toilet alongside the laundry. The unit also features a single carport with roller door.
Ideal for those searching for low maintenance living with conveniences within a short stroll.
With a long term tenant in place paying $210 per week the property is perfect for investors to add to their portfolio or vacant possession is available for those looking to occupy themselves.
To book a time for an inspection, please call Shelby Healey on 0428488685 or Matt Bowles on 0418509380

Description:
Solid First Home or Investment
Conveniently located close to Kennington reservoir and Kennington shopping precinct is this comfortable three bedroom brick veneer family home with built-in robes to all bedrooms. A large open plan living and dining area greets you when you open the front door which has a split system heating and cooling and direct access to the front entertaining area for those summer evenings. Large sliding glass doors allow you to keep this area private or open up the home to the meals area and natural light filled modern kitchen with plenty of storage. The property also has a well-maintained backyard with an area for entertainment which is undercover and easy access to the single garage via roller door. The property has recently been re-stumped and repainted throughout already for the new owners to call home or the astute investor to add to their portfolio

Description:
New Renovation in Top Location
Contemporary and luxurious, just having undergone a complete internal and external transformation this two bedroom unit is sure to impress.
The owners have thoughtfully included LED lighting to separate the open plan kitchen/meals and living area. The brand new kitchen is bright and airy with ample cupboards, heaps of bench space, separate pantry cupboard and new range hood. You will find the lighting scheme changes through to the living area to create a more comfortable and warm feel on new carpets.
Large windows throughout the living and bedrooms allow plenty of natural light and air flow through the unit, and there is a reverse cycle split system for extra comfort all year round.
Each of the two bedrooms have BIRs, and there is extra storage available with a convenient hallway linen cupboard. The spacious and stunning three piece bathroom is separate from the toilet and generous laundry space.
Fully fenced and secure back yard, ideal for keeping pets safe. The yard is divided to allow a concrete paved open sitting area and a lovely mulched garden area with pavers. Rear access is also available through the single semi-enclosed carport.
Kennington is such a popular area, and with a fantastic recent rental history you will be spoilt for choice with applicants should you choose to lease the property out. However, if you decide to owner occupy yourself, the friendly neighbourhood atmosphere of the complex will certainly appeal, as the unit is set back from the road.
Located only 2km from the CBD and only a short distance to Kennington Village, Strath Village and Strath Hill Shopping Complex, Kennington Reservoir and La Trobe University.
Insights: 4/8 Clarke Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
A Rare Opportunity
Positioned in a quiet, tree lined street of Kennington, this magnificent building allotment is the last available building block in this highly sought-after location. Surrounded by quality homes, this large allotment offers the astute buyer the opportunity to build their dream home to grand proportions (S.T.C.A).
Conveniently located within walking distance to Kennington Shopping Complex, Strath Village, La Trobe University, a range of schooling and kindergarten options, Kennington Reservoir, sporting facilities, shops and public transport, all within a few kilometres of the Bendigo CBD. What more could you ask for!
Land measures approximately 814m²
Large frontage of approximately 22 metres
Established trees at rear of block
Secure fencing on three boundaries
Sensible covenants
All services available
A rare offering to the market, large land allotments in such a desirable Kennington position are becoming very difficult to find.
Enquire for more details about this marvellous property.

Description:
A wonderful opportunity in the heart of Kennington
When opportunities present themselves like this, smack bang in the heart of prime Kennington, and offering a parcel of land measuring just under 1 acre, you need to take note!
At approx 3700m2, the property is close to Bendigo's CBD, train station, reputable primary and secondary schools, La Trobe Uni and various shopping centres.
Positioned amongst a very strong residential area with a mix of medium density housing development and established principal homes. This rare property will give any developer(s), consortiums and investment groups an opportunity to establish their skills and profession with no major risks, as the location speaks for itself.
The parcel is zoned General Residential, with two allotments on the title, and there's an unmade road/carriageway that is sited on the Eastern Boundary. There are endless options here including a medium to high density residential development, medical uses (surgery, dentist, medical complex), kindergarten, creche or similar (all STCA).
The original homestead has sat for many years and is need of a major restoration or renovation from the ground up. Dilapidated, but the heartbeat of this old relic is still beating ever so slightly for someone to take it on. The lot is quite flat and there is good access to drainage and Coliban services.
Always admired with many questions asked, be the opportunist to enquire today and start planning your next development.
Insights: 151 St Aidans Road, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
REFURBISHED KENNINGTON STUNNER
Totally refurbished, light-filled domain boasts a totally coordinated coastal theme with fresh paint, plantation shutters, timber look floors & new carpets throughout. The home features front lounge, dining/sitting room & main bedroom with central kitchen/meals/family area & 3 more bedrooms, bathroom & laundry to the rear. Revitalisation includes stunning new kitchen with high-end glossy cabinetry, marble bench tops & new appliances while the spacious meals zone spills through sliding doors to alfresco area. Family room includes cosy gas-log fire flanked by built-in cabinetry; both bathrooms have been stylishly updated with marble bench tops & in-situ showers & the new laundry includes benches & cupboards. Double carport with lock-up storage bays, bitumen driveway to double garage, adjoining workshop & landscaped grounds with sprinkler system. Elevated lot approx 1380m², close to Strath/Kennington Village shops, university, schools, public transport & Kennington Reservoir.
Don't miss this one off property in the best location

Description:
PRIME RENOVATION - SO MUCH POTENTIAL!
Positioned directly beside one of Bendigo / Kenningtons finest Primary Schools, complete with rear gate access through - how convenient & handy for the kids! This extremely popular position offers a spacious & clever floor-plan. With ample living areas, plus open plan meals, ducted gas heating & evaporative cooling, great storage and timber flooring, this incredible family home has so much potential with solid foundations, some cosmetic work would instantly add value.
Additional features include:
- 4 large bedrooms, central bathroom, multiple living areas.
- Separate shower room, to the bath & vanity.
- Separate toilet then spacious laundry, could be renovated into a second bathroom easily.
- Spacious allotment measuring 746 sq.m.
- Ducted evaporative cooling and heating.
- Retro kitchen with gas cooktop, dishwasher, large bench & cupboard space.
- Large double garage with storage and small water tank for garden.
- Access is close by to the CBD, public transport and all modern conveniences.
This excellent family home offers a unique opportunity for you to obtain a dwelling in a highly sought after pocket.

Description:
Corner allotment with side access - land bank, extend or update
This 1950's 3 bedroom weatherboard home sited on approx. 465m2 corner allotment, has all the ingredients for you to take on and really do a massive number on, to either update, extend or renovate.
Side access is off Farrington Street into the oversized carport, and storage shed with mezzanine floor.
The floorplan allows for flexibility with kitchen, bathroom and all wet areas in original condition.
Split system heating and cooling for year round comfort. Month to month tenancy at $290 per week.
Note: On its own title this home sits in a row with 42 & 44 McIvor Rd that are also for sale. The opportunity to purchase 2 or all 3 of the properties to land bank and develop (STCA) is an opportunity like no other so close to Bendigo Central.

Description:
Popular Location to suit a Retiree or Investor
This newly, partially renovated property is perfect for those looking for a solid unit with potential for further improvement or a proven rental record. With two bedrooms both with built in robes, heating and cooling and a spacious lounge room. The unit has new floor coverings, light fittings and window furnishings throughout and a fresh, internal paint. You can move in and enjoy the property as is or purchase as part of your investment portfolio with an expected rental return of $250 per week. The property is ideally positioned between the Bendigo CBD, Kennington Village and Strath Village, and with Kennington Reservoir and La Trobe University only a short walk. There's a spacious, fully enclosed yard with a private gate entrance. The space is ideal for entertaining, and a great area for both children and pets.

Description:
ATTENTION DEVELOPERS AND INVESTORS
* As a result of a Deceased Estate, a very rare opportunity is presented for your consideration.
* Located in the Blue Chip Kennington area and only metres from schools, Latrobe University, shopping precinct, hotels, cafes and much more, this property offers a myriad of uses.
* The 1,518m² (approx.) corner block encompasses a three bedroom house that requires some work but is very liveable, a surprisingly large one bedroom brick unit and also plenty of vacant land which is accessed from Cardogen Place.
* Rental returns on the house and unit of $450 plus are expected, or simply live in the house and provide the unit for Air BNB accommodation or another family member to reside in.
* With both the house and unit being independently serviced and a sizeable block of vacant land attached, the option to subdivide (STCA) this property and either sell or further develop it, presents a great opportunity for the astute investor.
* It is very rare that such a large block of land with an instant source of income becomes available in this area. This property is very realistically priced to sell and presents an opportunity that should not be overlooked.

Description:
Privacy & Flair in a Brilliant Kennington Locale
This architecturally designed, 1976 brick-based two storey dwelling sits in an elevated position with views overlooking Kennington. So many conveniences are just a stones throw away, with Strath Hill and Kennington Village shopping complexes, La Trobe University, Brennan Park swimming pool and Kennington Reservoir all within easy walking distance. The home has been freshly painted internally, with carpets updated in upstairs bedrooms recently and appliances updated approximately 2016.
On the ground floor, the property features:
One bedroom
Spacious lounge with open fireplace and cathedral ceilings
Large kitchen with updated dual electric oven, 5 burner gas cooktop, ample cupboard and bench space plus dishwasher
Study nook area beneath the staircase
Dining area which flows from the kitchen and offers views over the private, landscaped front yard, with mature native plants and grape vines
Magical views from every room - the downstairs atmosphere is tranquil
Large laundry with external access
Upstairs, the property features:
Main bedroom with a new three-piece ensuite plus a walk-in robe
Two more bedrooms with built-in robes and views over the treetops towards Strath Hill and the surrounding streetscape
Renovated bathroom with bath, shower, toilet and vanity
Offering ducted heating and evaporative cooling throughout, the home has also had a solar system installed with a total of 14 panels, which currently receives a generous tariff.
Step outside to a completely private wonderland of plant life, including native vegetation, veggie patches crafted with organic mulch to produce superb vegetables on a regular basis with rainwater harvested into two backyard tanks. An abundance of established trees including apricot, cherry, citrus, hazelnut, bay, feijoa, loquat, apple and plum. With a carport under the roof line, a playground next door for the kids and natural bushland at the rear, this property is a rare gem with such a beautiful lifestyle awaiting!
Be very quick to secure this magnificent and rare opportunity.

Description:
Location at the Right Price
The search is over! Here is the property in a great location, renovations completed and at the right price. Only minutes to the CBD, close to schools, supermarkets, parks & gardens and entertainment venues. This three bedroom home has a renovated kitchen, new bathroom, new carpets, polished timber floors and fresh paint throughout. Each bedroom has a BIR and ceiling fan. There is a spacious living area, kitchen and dining area with an additional study nook. The fully landscaped low maintenance backyard houses a garage and garden shed. With gas wall heater and evaporative cooling throughout, this home is both cosy and cool.
Perfect for a range of buyer types, whether you are downsizing, a first home buyer, retiree or investor, this one is for you.
